text:
Hey,

The scenario:

A page with a form, and the fields are disabled and blank.
There is a list under the form where by clicking on the list will fill in the 
blank fields (field reminds disabled). It uses Javascript to fill in the 
fields. 

When running the proxy server on this page, it comes back with an error (the 
page displays an error, not JMeter). When not running the proxy, it is fun.


The form itself has javascript embedded in it. When submitting it, it calls up 
a javascript function and passes on the values that way. 

I can't edit the page, Im just responsible for making a test case.
creator: azn_fuman@yahoo.ca
azn_fuman@yahoo.ca
text:
If I disable a the proxy server on both IE and JMeter. Run the page once, go 
back, re-enable the proxy server. It will record properly.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Need some more information to be able to debug this.

You say the page displays an error - does this give any clues as to what went
wrong? Might need to ask the page developer under what conditions the error
message is generated.

Have you included a Cookie Manager in the JMeter testplan?

Can you create a test plan that works without using the Proxy server? If so, how
does it differ from the one created when using the proxy?
